page.title: 18STROUD PARISH CHURCH
page.content: {Map Ref:-853054 { A small chapel was standing on the site in 1304.The Parish Church was created out of Bisley Parish later in 1360,and the chapel enlarged. The present tower and spire date from 1360 but the rest of the church was pulled down in 1868 to make room for the new church.The present building was consecrated in 1868. The spire of the church dominates views of Stroud from every direction. The church is in the centre of Stroud. The interior of the church has been improved a lot in recent years like the carved stone veredon which George Gillert Scott made. There are ten bells in the tower.
